intro: Gyptidium militare, commonly known as the military gentian, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens. Its botanical name reflects its historical use in military medicine due to its purported healing properties.
